chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R. Weiland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Restitution is joint/several with Derek Nehls (15CF76)

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

1 year county jail with work release, report by 7/20/17 between 6-7 a.m., this conditional time concurrent with jail time Defendant is now serving in other counties. 

Pay one set of costs.

Pay restitution of $19,353 to CC, joint/several with other defendants, specifically Derek Nehls.

Participate in and successfully complete Grant County Drug Treatment Court.

Count 3 dismissed and read in. 16CF61 also dismissed/read in.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is JOINT/SEVERAL with other defendants, namely Derek Nehls. DOC should note that the $2500 cash bond posted in this case has been applied towards the restitution debt. Clerk of Court has cut the restitution check and given that to the District Attorney's Victim/Witness Coordinator for disbursement to the victim.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
With work release, to begin on or before July 20, 2017 between 6-7 a.m.

JOC amended 1/16/18 per Stipulation and Order of 1/16/18: "Defendant may serve his conditional jail time in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept him, including, but not limited to, the Grant County Jail.
Concurrent with: jail sentences Defendant is presently serving in other counties

Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel provide Court with details of the parties' proposed agreement for resolution. State moves to delete the repeater enhancers on counts 1 and 2 and dismiss/read-in count 3. So ordered. Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 as amended (repeater modifier deleted; party to a crime modifier remaining). Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty. Counsel and Def addresses the Court. 

Sentence: 
Count 1 - sentence withheld for probation of 3 years years with conditions to include 1 year county jail with work release, report by 7/20/17 between 6-7 a.m. (def will be transferring from Grant County Jail and will make arrangements accordingly), this conditional time concurrent with jail time def is now serving in other counties. Additional conditions: pay one set of costs; pay restitution of $19,353, joint/several with other defendants, specifically Derek Nehls; credit in the event of revocation: 10 days; participation/successful completion of Grant County Drug Treatment Court is also a condition of probation. Count 3 dismissed and read in. 16CF61 also dismissed/read in. Felony admonishments including firearm prohibition stated.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Status in 15CF77 and 16CF61. Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA reports def has been accepted into TC in another county. Atty. M asks for plea/sentencing. Potential plea/sentencing set for 7/13 at 9.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
